de.esoco.lib.expression

Interface Action<T>

  • All Superinterfaces:
    java.util.function.Consumer<T>, java.util.function.Function<T,java.lang.Void>
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    Action.ThrowingAction<T,E>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractAction, ExceptionMappingAction
    Functional Interface:
    This is a functional interface and can therefore be used as the assignment target for a lambda expression or method reference.

    @FunctionalInterface
public interface Action<T>
extends Function<T,java.lang.Void>, java.util.function.Consumer<T>
    A function sub-interface for the implementation of actions that have no result. Implementations must implement the execute(Object) instead of evaluate(Object).

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      static interface  Action.ThrowingAction<T,E extends java.lang.Exception>
      A sub-interface that allows implementations to throw checked exceptions.

    • Method Detail

      • unchecked

        static <T,E extends java.lang.Exception> Action<T> unchecked(Action.ThrowingAction<T,E> fChecked)
        Takes an action that throws an exception and returns it as an action that can be executed without a checked exception. This method is mainly intended to be used with lambdas that throw exceptions.
        Parameters:
        fChecked - The checked action to wrap as unchecked
        Returns:
        The unchecked action

      • execute

        void execute(T rValue)
        this method must be implemented with the action functionality.
        Parameters:
        rValue - The value to execute the action upon

      • accept

        default void accept(T rValue)
        Specified by:
        accept in interface java.util.function.Consumer<T>

      • evaluate

        default java.lang.Void evaluate(T rValue)
        Description copied from interface: Function
        Evaluates the function on the input value and returns the resulting value. The declaration of this method does not contain a throws clause to make the execution of standard functions as simple as possible. In cases where a function implementation needs to signal a checked exception it should wrap it in an FunctionException which is a subclass of RuntimeException. In such a case the possibility of the occurrence of such exceptions should be documented appropriately in the function documentation.
        Parameters:
        rValue - The input value of the function
        Returns:
        The resulting (output) value (may be NULL)
        See Also:
        Function.evaluate(Object)

      • from

        default <O> Action<O> from(Function<O,? extends T> fPrevious)
        Returns a new function object that evaluates the result received from another function with this function. Implementations should typically subclass AbstractFunction which already contains an implementation of this method.
        Parameters:
        fPrevious - The function to produce this function's input values with
        Returns:
        A new instance of FunctionChain
